comments.author: reiichu

comments.text:
+PlantBoy a short of all this is bis are interested in males and females 
while panosexual is interested in cisgender transgender etc.

 Pansexual implies that there are many genders where as bisexuality implies 
that there are only two set genders. It's a matter of prefixes. Bi means 
two as in bisexual, bicycle, bilingual. Pan is a Greek prefix for all as in 
panchromatic, pandemonium, and pandemic. 

Based on the definitions of the prefixes a pansexual is, or can be 
attracted to people of all types of gender identities. 

There is: 

Cisgender- born male identify as a man, born female identify as a woman 
transsexual/transgender- born male identifies as a woman, born female 
identifies as a man 
androgynous- born male or female and identifies as a mixture of man and 
woman 
gender queer/third gender- born male or female and feels as if man, or 
woman is too limiting, identify as neither man nor woman.

captions.text: - Well, hello, everyone!

My name is Tyler Oakley
and today it is time
for another Q and Slay, but...

Normally I ask you guys to
submit questions on Twitter,

but if you recall,
during my fundraiser for

The Trevor Project for my
birthday, I had certain levels of

rewards that you could redeem
upon donating to the campaign;

one of those levels was a
guaranteed spot in a Q and Slay!

And this Q and Slay is all
questions submitted from donators

to The Trevor Project, so
thank you for donating,

let's get into it, I got
some questions to answer.
I don't know why I'm doing this.
Let's get into it.

Brent would like to know,
what other charities
or organizations do you support?
I support a whole bunch.

I really like dosomething.org,
they are an amazing

organization that helps connect
influencers with campaigns,

with teens, and getting
people involved in whatever

they are passionate about,
they're really great,
so I'm going to link to them below.

And as you guys know, I am
also really pasisonate about

the Taco Bell Foundation for
Teens, they are an organization

that I have partnered up
with, and they are trying

to help as many teens, just
like you guys, to graduate

from high school, and I have
a challenge for you guys.

If you haven't already, I
talked about it before, but

if you haven't already, go
click the link below and sign

the pledge that you will
be graduating high school.

It's so quick and so simple
and I want to get as many of my

people, you guys, to sign
the pledge, as possible,

so I think we can get,
like, 10,000 in one day,

I think you guys can do it,
but if you haven't signed

the pledge already, click the
link below, sign the pledge,

tweet at me when you do,
and show me a screenshot,

and I'm going to be sending
love to people who do.

John K. says, if there was
one thing that you could

improve on or fix in the
world, what would it be?

If I'm talking about the entire
world, I think there are so

many problems that could be
fixed, but I would say I want

people to have access
to clean water, food,
shelter, peace, and purpose.

Both Joseph and Lorena ask,
how are you doing, and,
Joseph and Lorena, thank you for asking!

I am doing really good, I am
super excited for tonight,

I am going to see Lady Gaga in
concert for the fourth time,

I am like, dying, I'm so
excited, "Artpop," slay me,

I am, like, ready to sing
every single lyric, so,
I'm pretty pumped, how are you guys doing?
Let me know in the comments below.

I actually do want to know.
Take a minute, let me know,

in the comments, how are you?
I hope you're doing well.

Melissa says, where do you
get inspiration to make

your videos, and what
YouTubers inspire you?

Um, I am inspired by everybody
that I watch, literally,

everybody that I have become
friends with, and I watch, and

whether they have millions
of subscribers, or literally

thousands of subscribers,
or tens of subscribers,

it doesn't really matter,
if you are just yourself,
then I am inspired by you.

I think there are lots of
different types of people

on YouTube, whether you're,
like, a beauty guru, or you do

skits, or film making, or
parodies, or gaming, there's tons

of things that can make
you successful on YouTube,

but I think at the core, I am
attracted to personalities,

and so, with that, I find
myself watching people that do,

you know, makeup tutorials
that are 20 minutes long,

and I'm sitting there watching,
and I'm like, I am not

the demographic for this,
but then I realize, like,

I am watching because I love
this person, as a human,

so I would say that I find
inspiration from people

that are just unapologetically
themselves, because

those are the people
that make me want to be
unapologetically myself.

John L. says, prediction
time, what do you think
you'll be doing in 10 years?

I foresee myself, in 10 years,
I'll be looking real cute,

I'll be convincing my
husband to take some time off
so that we can take our kids to go visit
their grandparents back in Michigan.

And then I'll be, like,
trying to figure out where

I can possibly leave our dog
while we're gone out of town.

Right. And charging my batteries
to bring our camera along,
because we'll probably be still vlogging.
That doesn't sound so bad.
Johnny says, Tom Daly or Channing Tatum?

I'm sorry, Channing, I know
that we shared a moment

when we took a selfie together
at the MTV Movie Awards,

but I gotta go with Tom
Daly because I am all about
that little booty...

I can't get into this,
hopefully Tom Daly will be there

10 years from now, and
I'll be telling him to

take some time off. That's
who, what, that's exactly,
that's what's going to go happen.

Kenneth says, in a relationship,
what has worked better,
somebody that's completely like you,
or completely the opposite of you?

Honestly, I'm going to
have to go with somebody

that's just like me in a lot
of ways, like, I like to just

like, share certain levels
of passions for things,
like, I just, at the end of the day,
must love dogs, must love Gaga.
Elizabeth says, did you ever get your
extra polka dotty eyepatch?

Now, I could kind of explain
this story to you guys,

but I feel like it'd be
better if I just let it be

an inside joke for the people
that have seen that video,

no, I haven't, which I'm
still fuckin' pissed about.

Mark says, where are you
taking me on our date?

Mark, this is all, like,
moving very quickly,
you're making me blush and flustered,
probably, like, a chain restaurant
or a food court, if you're lucky.

Seamus says, what is the
best advice you could give
to young people today?
It is so simple, don't be so nervous.

If I could turn back time, I
would spend so much less time

worrying about what other
people thought of me,

and more time singing
at the top of my lungs,

at like, auditions, and then
dancing at school dances,

and telling the people that
I've liked that I liked them.

Everybody is too nervous,
worrying that everyone else
is worrying about them.
Nobody cares.

Sasha says, while I'm
starting a YouTube channel,
how do I keep viewers interested?

And, there's no easy way
to do it, there's no, like,

special thing you can do to,
like, succeed on YouTube,

although I wish I could
tell ya, I wish I knew,

but I would say there's a
couple steps that will help you

in your process, and,
number one, be consistent,
I think that's the biggest thing,
my next piece of advice would have to be,
connect with the people that watch.

It's really simple to just get
bogged down by the numbers,

but these are real people
watching, you guys are watching,

and I want to connect with
each and every one of you,

one on one, it's the same as
if you have 10 subscribers

or five million subscribers,
connect with the people
that appreciate what you do.

And then, my final piece of
advice, I don't even know

if I should give it to
you, because I don't know

if it will make sense,
but, it's kill your babies,
and let me explain what it means.

When you're editing a video,
when I'm editing a video,
I love every single bit of it.

But if I were to put up a
video that's 15 minutes long,

that might be kind of
off-putting to a lot of people

that don't necessarily have
that much time in a day,

and so, I say kill your
babies, and that's probably

not the best politically
correct phrase to use,

but, to me, each clip is
a baby, but I want to kill

the, like, weak babies so
that the best babies live?

Survival of the fittest?
Does this even make sense?
Is it even kosher? I don't even know.
Kill your babies. Don't kill any babies.

Just kill your babies
while you're editing.

Haley says, if you could marry
any one fictional character,
who would it be?

I would probably have to
say Zac Efron's character
in "The Lucky One."

If you haven't seen it, I
am telling you right now,

don't watch it unless you
want all of your expectations

as to your future husband
to be shattered by reality.
Timothy would like to know, do you speak
any languages besides English?

And, I have told you guys
before, but, in high school,
I took Spanish, in college I took Hebrew,

but I am the worst at
learning languages, so,

whenever I travel abroad,
to, like, anywhere that

you guys live to do any,
like, conventions or meet-ups,

I try to learn some of
the language and some of

your dialects, but, I am, I
am, like, so bad, honestly,

just the worst, but I
try, and then I feel like
that's, like, good for something.

Shane says, Troy or Casper,
and I can't decide because
I don't know what you're asking me
to choose them based on.

Are we talking, like, best
dressed, or like, best skin,

or tallest, or best South
African, or best accent,

or best kisser, some of those
categories I could decide on,
but I'm not gonna choose because
you didn't give me a category.

So, this one is anonymous,
and they wanted to know,
how do you stay positive and focused,

and, I don't, I don't,
always, and I think you should
know that none of your favorite people do,
everybody that you admire has shitty days,
everybody that you admire has lazy days,

but, for me, when I'm trying
to stay focused and positive,

I surround myself with people
that are focused and positive,

and I once heard a quote
that is, you are the average

of the five people you
spend the most time around,
and so, you kind of have a choice,

do you want to hang
out with lazy assholes,
or do you want to hang out with positive,
productive, amazing humans?

Timothy John says, do
you think there will ever

be a time when we don't
need The Trevor Project?
And, I can only hope so.

The Trevor Project is a great
resource for people who are

going through troubling
times, if they need support,

or somebody to talk to,
hopefully someday we won't

need that resource, but until
that day, I hope the resource

is as functioning and as
available as possible,

so, if you're watching
this, please keep continuing

the project, the link to them
is below, give them some love,
they are an amazing resource.
Okay, so that is all the questions that

I have for you guys today,
I hope you guys enjoyed it,

if you do, push the thumbs
up and give me some love,

I think we can get one
hundred thousand likes
in the first day.

Push the thumbs up button
right now, I'm waiting.

If you want to see my latest
Q and A, it is right there,

if you want to see my latest
Friday video, it's right there,

and if you want to be
my person of the week,

just click right there, and
get a shirt or a sweater

or a poster or new phone
cases, I have been working on

some cute new phone cases,
this one is available
right now in the store, go get it,

it is a limited edition,
so get it this week.
It might not be available next week.

Send me a picture of you
being cute with something

that you get from the
store and you might be

my person of the week,
and subscribe right there,

because I make new videos every
single Tuesday and Friday,

but that is all I have
for you guys this week,
I hope you have a fabulous life,
and I will see you guys next time! Later!

I've gotta go, I have a Gaga
concert to go to, so, deuces!
